A scene from The Martian , which will be screened at the Science Film Festival of India from January 14. —Photo: AP

In a cinematic treat for sci-fi movie enthusiasts, Goa is all set to host the first edition of the Science Film Festival of India from January 14.

The three-day festival is organised by Vigyan Parishad, a body of the Union Department of Science and Technology, in association with the State department, the Entertainment Society of Goa, the Goa Science Centre and the National Institute of Oceanography, a press release said.

Taking notes from the huge potential of “Brand Goa” as a film festival destination, Vigyan Parishad will hold the event on the Entertainment Society of Goa premises here.

Beside film screenings, discussions, interactive sessions and workshops with experts and scientists will be held, the release said.

Experts like scientists G. Madhavan Nair and Suresh Naik and film-maker Mike Pandey would share their expertise. The organisers said they would have to narrow down their target group to students from Class VII to IX and Class XI, but people from all age groups could register themselves as delegates.

“This is an opportunity for all of us students of science to come together and witness this freshly created concept of a film festival themed around the marvels of science. Youngsters should utilise this opportunity and participate in the competition Dream to Screen ,” the release said.

The festival will showcase several sci-fi films, including The Martian , Roland Emmerich’s 2012 , and World War Z. — PTI
title: Sun, surf and now sci-fi films in Goa
